comment.author: 15088225@N07
comment._content: These streamer shots are great.  I was just looking at the streamer photo in the SJ Hood book today and it brought back memories of standing above the crowds holding the end of a streamer.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/imagegallery] Agreed!

It is the White Star Line / Dalgetty's Wharf at Millers Point looking south up Darling Harbour.  Here is a photo from the reverse direction showing the building at left - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4886823914/]

comment.author: 15088225@N07
comment._content: www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-f115-sd&rgn&am... zoom in, then pan down to Dalgety and Co's wharf to the White Star Line. The map is highly addictive! Or maybe you already know that...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/imagegallery] Yes,  that map is great fun!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/imagegallery] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Hi, thanks for the information and that wonderful map! What detail! So useful in terms of understanding the shipping industry in Sydney.
Looks like you're right beachcomber and it makes sense seeing as that was where the White Star Line's wharf was. Judging by the fashion, it is likely that these images were taken in the 1920s.
Stay tuned for more of these images. We think Sam Hood may have liked photographing the streamers...
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 15088225@N07
comment._content:
Great new batch of streamer photos.

Really off-topic, but just reading some of Charles Darwin's letters from the HMS Beagle.  In 1836 he writes to his sister about Sydney "this is a most villainously dear place"  :-)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/imagegallery] Thanks, glad you enjoyed them.

It's a nice off-topic though. :) Do you think he was being facetious? Ha!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 15088225@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] :-) I think he was serious as he mentioned a bit about what he needed after so long at sea. My new favourite map: www.lib.utexas.edu/maps/historical/australia_1838.jpg Greetings from Flindersland to Guelphia.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/imagegallery] Love a good map, thanks for the link Mangrove Rat. :) Ha! Guelphia definitely sounds fancier.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
